summary: liverpool manager brendan rodgers has reminded raheem sterling and jordon ibe about their professional responsibilities . sterling , the england international who will lead liverpool 's line at wembley on sunday in the absence of the injured daniel sturridge , was exposed for inhaling the legal high nitrous oxide on monday . then 24 hours pictures emerged of sterling and ibe with shisha pipes . rodgers would not discuss whether he would give gerrard available after a three-match suspension .

aspect: 1. Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers reminded Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe about their professional responsibilities.
2. Rodgers urged them to learn from a chastening week.
3. Sterling was exposed for inhaling a legal high and later pictured with a shisha pipe.
4. Rodgers spoke to both players in his office but neither will be disciplined.
5. Rodgers wants to draw a line under the matter and focus on steering Liverpool into the FA Cup final.
6. Rodgers doesn't think Liverpool are ready to progress.
7. Rodgers thinks losing is part of the journey and players should learn from it.
8. Rodgers hasn't revealed if he will recall Steven Gerrard for the FA Cup semi-final against Aston Villa.
explain:
Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers reminded Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe about their professional responsibilities. 

Explain the main focus of this aspect.
Main Focus: Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers reminded Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe about their professional responsibilities.

Give your opinion on the aspect.
Opinion: It is appropriate for Rodgers to remind Sterling and Ibe about their professional responsibilities, especially after the recent incidents.

The aspect of the summary refers to the situation in which Brendan Rodgers, the manager of Liverpool, reminded Raheem Sterling and Jordan Ibe about their professional responsibilities and urged them to learn from a "chastening week". This aspect suggests that Sterling, who is an England international and will lead the team's line in the absence of injured Daniel Sturridge, was exposed for inhaling legal high nitrous oxide on Monday and then pictures were published of him and Ibe with shisha pipes. Rodgers, in response, talked about their responsibilities and urged them to learn from this experience.

Brendan Rodgers reminded Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe of their professional responsibilities after the England international was exposed for inhaling a legal high nitrous oxide on Monday and then pictures emerged of Sterling and Ibe with shisha pipes.

Brendan Rodgers did not discipline Raheem Sterling or Jordon Ibe after they were seen inhaling legal high Nitrous Oxide and smoking shisha pipes respectively. The Liverpool manager instead spoke to both players in his office to remind them of their professional responsibilities.

Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers wants to move on from the controversies involving Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe and shift the focus to the FA Cup final match against Aston Villa. Rodgers is aiming to put the distractions behind and keep the team united while preparing for the cup final.
Brendan Rodgers believes that Liverpool FC is not yet ready to make significant progress towards their goals due to various obstacles.

One core idea of aspect "7. Rodgers thinks losing is part of the journey and players should learn from it." is that the Liverpool manager, Brendan Rodgers believes that losing is an inevitable part of the football journey and that players should learn from it and improve their game. He does not see losing or setbacks as a reason to become disheartened, but as an opportunity to grow and become better players. By acknowledging this, he is encouraging his players to remain positive even in the face of adversity, and to use challenges to their advantage to improve their overall game. This idea focuses on the resilience that is necessary to overcome hardships and be successful in the long term.

Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers has reiterated the need for professionalism from young players Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe, after the pair were pictured using legal highs and shisha pipes. He has reminded them of their responsibilities as representatives of the club and has warned them against any such behavior in the future. Despite his warnings, Rodgers is not revealing if he will bring back Steven Gerrard for the FA Cup semi-final against Aston Villa.
